div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 738 Thrace?, c. 1955 Burial: c. 330-320 B.C. (T) Contents: AR (hundreds) Thracian Chersonese: 106+ hemidr. Aenus: 1 diob. Byzantium: 9+ hemidr. Calchedon: 1+ hemidr. Parium: 16+ hemidr. Disposition: New York 120 (chiefly Chers.) ; Paris 3 Chers.; Athens 1 Byzantium Varoucha, BCH 1956, p. 228 Le Rider, Deux tr√©sors, p. 54, note 1, illus. (3) With the New York lot was a st. of Mazaeus from Tarsus but this is most probably intrusive
